title: Feature: Group-level default working directory
body:
## Feature Request

**Problem:**
When working with session groups, every new session requires manually specifying the working directory path. There's no way to configure a group so that new sessions automatically open in a specific directory.

This is especially noticeable with worktree workflows — if you create a worktree in one session within a group, new sessions in the same group don't inherit that worktree's directory. You have to re-specify the path or `--worktree` flag each time.

**Proposed Solution:**
Add a group-level `default_path` configuration option so that new sessions created within a group automatically use that directory as their working directory.

This could work as:

1. **A group property** set at creation or update time:
   ```bash
   agent-deck group create my-group --default-path /path/to/project
   agent-deck group update my-group --default-path /path/to/project
   ```

2. **Inherited by new sessions** — when pressing `n` in the TUI or using `agent-deck add` with `-g my-group` without an explicit path, the group's `default_path` would be used.

3. **Overridable** — explicitly passing a path to `agent-deck add` would still take precedence.

**Use Case:**
- A team member has a group called "feature-x" tied to a specific worktree at `repo/.worktrees/feature-x`
- Every new session in that group should default to that worktree directory
- Currently they must remember and type the full path each time

**Alternatives Considered:**
- Always specifying the path manually (current behavior — tedious and error-prone)
- Using shell aliases (works but is external to AgentDeck)
